metadata.title: CVE-2017-14102 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: MIMEDefang 2.80 and earlier creates a PID file after dropping privileges to a non-root account, which might allow local users to kill arbitrary processes by leveraging access to this non-root account for PID file modification before a root script executes a "kill `cat /pathname`" command, as demonstrated by the init-script.in and mimedefang-init.in scripts.

criterions.comment: mimedefang package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.83-1').
